text: Is there a way to add a *full width background* within a module with the new dnd system? I haven't found an easy way to do this except add JS to manually add it to the dnd section parent of the module. Which seems to be a bit hacky.
You can use the image field in line if you want to do a background
<@U01B10S09FU> Are you just talking about setting a background image on a DND section from a coded template?

Hi hi! This morning I'm finding myself struggling with setting a default for a module snippet used inside of a template.

I'm looking at the documentation on this page (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates>) and I'm failing to grasp how it would work for a grouped parameter.

Say the module has a field like this `module.color_theme.background_image_options` how would you set that in a theme? (Note, this module was built before Styles were available, so this is just a standard module field group with a choice field inside of it)

My attempts this morning had me with code that looked like this  `{% module "uniqueid" path="the/correct/path", label="a great label", background_image_options="solid_color" %}` but that didn't seem to do the trick. I also tried calling it as  `color_theme.background_image_options` but again no dice.

I'm sure this is something silly simple and I'm just a few cups of coffee short of solving this. lol But any assistance would be greatly appreciated. :smile:
That will still constrain to the dnd module container, which will not allow a full width background.
This is on a blog single post template, so DnD is out too. :disappointed:
If it's fullwidth I usually add the module inside a dnd_section set as fullwidth with no margin and padding and add those inside the module

Ya I understand it in the template but I wanted to give them an option right in a module that is full width. I'll just add a class with JS for now as a workaround. It doesn't seem HubSpot has anything built in to handle this.

Im not so sure I see the point in what youre trying to do. It seems kind of like youre trying to rebuild something that you can already do from the section settings?

Assuming there is only one module in the section and you want to set the section background from the module you can always just apply it to the module that is full width.

If there are more than one module in the section I donâ€™t see what is wrong with just clicking on the section and setting it there.

Are you trying to do anything fancy which is causing you to set it with JS?

Let's say they have the module in 50 places on the site and they decide to change the background color of that section's module or want to keep the styling in the theme css (lets say its a background color variable) rather than a color picker. Now you have to go into 50 pages to update the background.

Doesn't seem like a great setup.

It's easier for me to just select the closest ancestor of the dnd section in JS of that specific module and add a class. Now it's more global when I want to make a change.

I'm open to any suggestions but I can't think of one.

I think I understand. Are there other modules in this section? Can you bake the color into the theme settings so that they are globalized there. Then have it just set that background color on the module and not the section? This will only work if there are no other modules in that section.

You could always use a reusable section and add a classname to section wrapper. Then key the background off of that classname <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas/sections#section-classes> Those color options could be kept in theme settings.
